info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 2:01PM MDT until August 15 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 154 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fair Creek, La, Gunnison River, Snyder Creek, West Creek, Bear Creek, Fall Creek, East Creek, Little Dominguez Creek, Dry Fork Big Dominguez Creek, Red Creek, Big Dominguez Creek, Gill Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly Big Dominguez Creek and CO-141 near Thimble Rock Point in rural Southwestern Mesa County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
